##  Tablas

Imprimir tablas en R es complicado.

Primero carguemos datos:

```{r}
alim = foreign::read.spss("data/M3/PaisesProteinasExamen.sav", to.data.frame = T)
alim$Pais = trimws(alim$Pais)
```


Primero usemos `summary()`:

```{r}
summary(alim)
```

Luego usemos `skimr`

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(skimr)

my_skim <-
  skim_with(
    character = sfl(
      empty = NULL,
      min = NULL,
      max = NULL,
      whitespace = NULL
    ),
    numeric = sfl(hist = NULL)
  )

resumen = my_skim(alim)

resumen2 = resumen
resumen2$n_missing = NULL
resumen2$complete_rate = NULL

resumen2
```
